title: Roles?
body:
Hi,

I've been playing league for about 2 months now, and I'm about to hit level 30.

I've played every single role (with success, consistency lacking tho), and I've enjoyed all but top (I feel like it's so isolated from everything :( ).

I'm leaning towards support but people have told me that support at low elo is so hard to get right as the skill level of your adc, etc isn't high enough to take real advantage of your plays.
ADC is obviously a great role to play, action packed from the get-go. I just find that without proper support i can get bogged down (I'm not good enough to carry tbh).
Mid - Some champs i can,some I can't. Matchups throw me off, etc. I feel i'm not good enough mechanically to make a real difference.
Jg - I've only really jungled with WW and i've had great success. Apprently he is not really effective once it comes to higher ranked games?

Any ideas you may have would be welcome!

replies.body:
Hey, support main here. Support is a great role to carry with, even in bronze. 

But you have to be experienced to carry. Just **Janna** shielding people and trading some auto-attacks will not carry the team. There are ways to carry on passive supports like **Janna** and **Soraka**, but it's quite hard for low elo players. 

I'd recommend getting into _"lane winner"_ supports or _"play maker"_ supports. Let me explain;

+ Lane winners are champions like **Sona** **{{champion:37}}**,** Nami** {{champion:267}}, **Bard** {{champion:432}}... etc.
These guys are usually really easy to win lane with. They have high poke and strong sustain, this means that even if your ADC trades badly, you can just heal to full. 

 This is great in bronze because people tilt easily and don't know how to come back from games very well. Since it's so easy to win lane with them, you're almost guaranteed to go positive or even in the laning phase.

 These champions will teach you to be aggressive, focus poke on ADC, and have good positioning. 

 The one draw back these_ "lane winners"_ have is that they often struggle against burst and engage. Although champions like **Nami** and **Bard** can be mastered to somewhat overcome this.

The next group of champions are _"play makers"_. My personal favourite :D

+ These guys are every ADC's worst nightmare, tanky, lots of damage, and shit tons of engage. Champions like **Leona** {{champion:89}}  , **Thresh** {{champion:412}}, **Blitzcrank** {{champion:53}} and **Nautilus** {{champion:111}}... etc.

 These guys can solo ADC's in the early game, while also having so much CC to lock them down in ganks and fights. A good player can be as impactful as a jungler, and will snowball games to crazy levels if given the chance. But, they also play great from behind, and have decent peel in their kits.

 These champions will teach you how to; roam, trade smartly, capitalize on mistakes and peel.

 The downside to these guys is, that winning lane isn't as straightforward as with **Sona**. If you make a mistake, you don't have crazy sustain to fall back on. Then the jungler will have to help you. They are also harder to play, **Thresh** and **Blitzcrank** are especially hard if your opponent is good.

That's essentially support in a nutshell. You'll need to learn how to play each of these guys individually, but I hope that what I put here helps.

Most common supports will fit into these 2 categories or be hybrids (like **Taric** and **Alistar**). There are a few more categories of poke and denial supports, but that's getting a little niche. 

Sorry for the long post!
Honestly i don't think Sona is a good recommendation at all right now, so many champs do what she does better (hell Nami is basically a better Sona.)
You're correct on this. But she is by far the easiest support to play. She's usually recommended for anyone new or inexperienced at the role.

I tend to prefer Blitz and Thresh (mainly because I feel their kit is really multifunctional).
I guess I'll try out a few more support champs, thanks for the info, really opened my eyes!

Do you recommend any streamers/youtubers that can help? Or any guides basically. I'm sturggling to find resources that help with positioning, etc.

So first up before i read the rest of your post (i've read atm before your talking about the roles.)

Play the roles that you want to learn, and have fun playing, don't listen to other people, you can climb as any role, if you are consistently good, and you get consistently good by learning in every game.

Now as a note, you will start ranked provisionals at a Silver 4 Match-Making Rating (Or MMR), don't be worried if you lose a few and end up in bronze, it's a good thing to learn and climb rather then anything else.

Work on yourself as a player, and don't worry about your wins and losses, and you will find you will climb without even realizing.

As for when roles start to be harder to carry with or stuff like that, below about plat, nothing matters, counters don't matter, what matters is your skill level.

Having read the rest of your post, Jungle WW is fine, he can be shut down, but if you learn to play him well enough (thinking about cooldowns, CC, who to get fed.) you will climb fairly easily with him.

ADC is fine, but as you have said, you need a support who knows what they are doing (which are few and far between in lower MMR) while it's not a role i would recommend, if you enjoy it, go for it.

Mid, thing is you need to learn these things, mechanics cross over into every role and a lot of the mechanics you can learn in mid are universal (Resource management, Cooldown management, Roaming, Ganking, Lane positioning) to all other roles, and can come in very handy when you are climbing.

Like i said, you pick for yourself, no one can tell you what you will be best at, and no one can make you better, you have to aim to better.

Thanks for the post!

Some good points there. I might reconsider mid!

Do you know where I can get some good learning resources? Positioning, mana management, etc?

Learn to play top and mid lane. These lanes will teach all those valuable lessons about self warding, roaming, TP, watching the mp. You WILL be punished many times and learn most lessons the hard way. You don't have to worry about trying to work in with another random player and can work on your own lane management.
You should recognise which role suits you the most but its always good to have experience in all.

If you like Support but don't want to rely on your ADC so much, I suggest simply avoiding Tanks that have to go all in to do something (Leona, Thresh), and extremely passive supports (Soraka, Janna). Pick something that puts out a lot of damage like Sona or Karma so you can pressure the enemy by yourself. If your ADC is absolutely useless, don't be afraid to roam more, such as ganking mid or helping your jungler invade.

Even with that said, you'll always want to play something you like. You will perform better on what you like and practice with than just whatever someone else tells you  to play.
